instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BKLT_EN_R: What is BKLT_EN_R? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. The “_R” suffix means that the signal is asserted when it is high, as in 3.3v, which is the opposite of the “_L”  suffix.
definitions.BKLT_SD: What is BKLT_SD? BKLT_SD is a pin of the LED driver that goes to the voltage divider that feeds the gate of the transistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H and the backlight circuit. The LED driver will short this pin to ground when backlight circuit is ready to turn on. Prerequisites are 1) it is told to turn on via enable signal, the screen has communicated with the LED driver 2) current sensing circuit is working 3) does not detect an over-current situation such as the backlight power rail being shorted to ground.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.07 not turning on
threads.message:
Hello, I have received a Macbook Pro with no power.

The device was affected by water damage, I fixed all the corrosion found, but it is still the same.
The voltage is 5v and 0.05a to 0.08a slowly fluctuating.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>  is stable
<SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL> is 0.200V going to 0.400V.
LC320 in diode mode is 0.009, is normal or short?

Is any help that I can get to finish the issue quicker?


Thanks in advance.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.07 not turning on
threads.message:
I don't have a board for comparison, but such reading is very low for <SIGNAL>5V_S2</SIGNAL> power line.
You can try injecting voltage and check if something heats.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.07 not turning on
threads.message: I have injected 2v on  LC320  and UP700 is getting hot.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.07 not turning on
threads.message:
Remove it and check again in diode mode.
Check on its output too (<SIGNAL>5V_SW_LCD</SIGNAL>).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.07 not turning on
threads.message: I took out the UP700, and measured all the lines, but <SIGNAL>EDP_BLC_5V_EN</SIGNAL> is shorted to the ground. UP710 might be faulty?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.07 not turning on
threads.message:
Yes, confirmed the  SLG4AP43605V( UP710 ) is shorted to ground. Now the issue is that I am unable to find this ic.
Any hint?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.07 not turning on
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.07 not turning on
threads.message:
I have removed the short, and the MacBook is turning on, but now I get full fan spin and no backlight or touch bar on.
Any help would be appreciated.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.07 not turning on
threads.message:
Do you get image, only missing backlight on internal LCD?
Did you check UP710 signals?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.07 not turning on
threads.message: I get image, but no backlight. I have replaced the backlight driver but is same. I will check the signals as well shortly.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.07 not turning on
threads.message:
UP710 from the schematics I see that is enabling the display, which is working; I went to UP800 is not giving any voltage on <SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_SW</SIGNAL>, this was replaced.
QP800 I have 11.5V on pin 3 and 11.9 on pin 4.
I am quite confused as I can't spot any other short or any reason why UP800 is not producing voltage for <SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_SW</SIGNAL>.
Touchbar and backlight are both not working,

Sorry if this sound awkward, but I never worked on these motherboards before.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.07 not turning on
threads.message:
I don't know what kind of voltage do you expect on <SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_SW</SIGNAL>.
There is not what you think!

QP800 needs low voltage on Gate.
For this, UP800 must pull down <SIGNAL>BKLT_SD</SIGNAL> (0V).

Apart of <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_R</SIGNAL> (high), UP800 requires a good communication with LCD assembly (T-CON), through I2C bus (<SIGNAL>I2C_BKLT_SCL</SIGNAL>/SDA).
M1 sends backlight adjust command to T-CON via SPI bus, not directly to UP800.

I recommend you to test with known good LCD assembly.
Just in case, check diode mode to ground on both pins of DP800; w/ and w/o LCD connected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.07 not turning on
threads.message:
Thanks for your answer; I checked diode mode with the connected or disconnected screen. It is the same value.
I also notice another thing: If I close the lid, it is staying the same; it should go to sleep, right?  <SIGNAL>LID_OPEN</SIGNAL> line is 1.158V 
It's not making any difference. I tried to connect type c to HDMI, and I got a black screen, but the screen is showing the login on the MacBook.( I see with the flashlight.
I don't have a screen in stock to test it. But I should not get a voltage on the output of the backlight even if the screen is faulty?
Like LP800 is 0 V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v 0.07 not turning on
threads.message:
All right, My apologies; I should have checked with a new screen. I found a broken screen but showing backlight.
It Is amazing how the components communicate with each other.
I kept thinking was a board issue.

Thanks for everything.
